title: Sophie Ellis-Bextor admits singing wrong lyrics ‘for quite some time’
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Sophie Ellis-Bextor has admitted that she’s been singing lyrics wrong for ‘quite some time’ and has only just noticed her mistake.

The Murder On The Dancefloor songstress confessed to Lorraine Kelly that she’d accidentally re-worded parts to Cher’s hit song Take Me Home, which she’d covered back in 2001.

Explaining that she only realised her error when re-recording the numbers, Sophie revealed: ‘It was quite funny because I went back into the studio to re-record vocals for things like Take Me Home and Murder and I realised firstly that I’d been singing the lyrics to Take Me Home wrong for quite some time.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I got very comfortable in a completely different way.’

Whoops.

Elsewhere in the interview, Sophie talked about cameoing in the last series of Game Of Thrones alongside her husband Richard Jones.

Sophie Ellis-Bextor dropped by Lorraine for a chat (Picture: ITV)

‘Richard and I are really big fans of the show and we knew a couple of other musicians that had also become extras,’ Sohpie said.

‘We just asked.’

Going into details about what scene she featured in, Sophie explained: ‘It was the third episode of the last series where they had the massive battle.

‘At the time it was the most expensive single piece of teleivison ever filmed, so even if you don’t watch the programme, just seeing enterprise on that level… and walking into a room full of extras, 300 men with beards on was really funny.’

She added: ‘It was definitely fun, there was a lot of giggles it was slightly absurd.

‘It was a very dark battle so we couldn’t see ourselves at all.’

Lorraine airs weekdays at 8.30am on ITV.

description: Sophie Ellis-Bextor admits singing wrong lyrics to 'for quite some time' on Lorraine.
